definition: Jacques René Chirac (1932-), president of France 1995-2007
to hope/to admire/variant of 稀[xi1]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
variant of 剋|克[ke4]
to scold/to beat

sentences.english: Even president Jacques Chirac, said the team had made the country proud.
sentences.chinese: 尽管希拉克总统，说球队令全国为以自豪。

sentences.english: In exchange, Paris, Chirac's government to withdraw the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 作为交换，巴黎市政府撤销对希拉克的起诉。

sentences.english: Chirac told the Barre, you can ask any question, there is no taboo.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克告诉巴雷，可以问任何问题，没有什么禁忌。

sentences.english: Both Mr. Chirac and Mr. Villepin say they will file complaints against Bourgi.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克和德维勒班都表示，他们将对布吉提出控告。

sentences.english: Not much difference there with Chirac.
sentences.chinese: 这和希拉克的没有什么大不同。

sentences.english: President Chirac said that, after the incident occurred, the European countries expressed their support to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克说，事件发生后，欧洲各国向美国表示了声援。

sentences.english: Locate the high plateau in Thessaly and bring Hierakles there.
sentences.chinese: 在狄瑟利找到高原并把希拉克勒斯带到那里。

sentences.english: Dai Bingguo forwarded a letter for President Chirac by President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国转交了胡锦涛主席致希拉克总统的信。

sentences.english: Chirac asked Zhu to pass on his greetings to President Jiang.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克请朱总理转达对江主席的问候。

sentences.english: After 12 years of Mr Chirac, this was the Socialist Party's election to lose.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克先生当家的12年之后，社会党丢掉了选举。

sentences.english: He reaffirmed that his government will continue to firmly uphold the One-China policy.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克重申法政府将继续坚定奉行一个中国政策。

definition: Mitterrand
François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
Emmanuel Macron (1977-), president of France from 2017
Elysée Palace, the residence of the president of the French Republic
former prime minister
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Nicolas Sarkozy (1955-), French UMP politician, President 2007-2012
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
Angela Merkel (1954-), German CDU politician, chancellor from 2005
former president
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Anwar Al Sadat
Raffarin, prime minister of France under Jacques Chirac
